inn1.comm: 138 kph, a little wayward by his standards as the full length ball carries with it so much room that the batsman has no trouble leaving it alone
back of a length on off stump and he goes slightly back and defends it into the on side
rises after pitching, but Jamshed has seen this good length ball pitching outside off and wants nothing to do with it
too wide outside off and left alone again. Steyn returns to the top of his mark after a lingering little stare.
much tighter as the full length ball is on off stump and Jamshed moves forward to block
141 kph, just short of a good length and this time he is only a shade outside off as Jamshed's feet stay put as he punches to mid-off
lovely shape straight away as the fullish ball swerves towards the two slips after pitching on and around the off stump. Left alone
shuffles around in his crease butthe bowler is unperturbed as he invests in another lovely, full length outswinger
this doesn't swing and is on the pads as Shehzad pushes it away through midwicket to get off the mark
gets right behind that back of a length ball on off stump and presents a dead straight bat
"Beautiful, V" comes the call from the slips as he keeps it nice and full and gets this to jag away from the batsman, who did well not to be tempted
dabbed away towards the covers, didn't look too convincing with that shot as Philander bowls it back of a length on the off stump corridor
pierces the gap between point and cover, though his feet moved only after the ball was struck. His timing suffers as a result and it is only a couple
shortish ball on off pushes him back in his crease, but Jamshed is solidly behind that
140 kph, drew him into the drive as he angles the full length ball across the left-hander. Thickish outside edge wanders away to point
140 kph, head right over the line of the ball as Steyn keeps it full on middle and off. Solidly defended off the back foot
brought his top hand into play to nudge that shortish ball over the top of off stump to mid-on

137 kph, clipped away and there will be no stopping that. He wanted to play a similar stroke the last ball but Steyn's length was shorter. This one was perfectly in the slot to whip through midwicket off the back foot
lovely swing away from the batsman as he keeps it full and on the off stump corridor. Shehzad is wise to it and ignores
too much swing. Although that was a tad bit harsh. Shehzad was walking down the pitch again forcing the bowler to go wider, and the swing takes it past the wide line
flicked away through square leg and Amla cannot get to it. Too straight from Philander this time and Shehzad had move across to the off stump to work it away nicely
short and he drags it from outside off, but this time it goes straight to Amla as he gets it off the bottom of the bat
little shuffle to off stump again as he tries to negotiate this length ball, but this time it seams in and beats his defensive bat
solidly back behind that, back of a length on off stump, easily kept out
shortish on and around off stump and Shehzad gets back in line with it and defends
persists with a good fullish length on off stump as Jamshed gets back and blocks
142 kph, lovely shot. Steyn floated it outside off and he leaned into a charming little cover drive which finds the gap in the offside infield.
back of a length on off stump as jamshed works the angle and finds midwicket off the back foot
143 kph, another flowing off drive and AB refuses to let this past him. It beat short cover, who dived full length to his left, but the captain hunts it down from mid-off and keeps it to a single
length ball outside off stump which is calmly left alone
143 kph, ends the over by targeting the stumps with a fullish ball and Shehzad pushes it to mid-on
length ball angled across the left-hander, who stays back in his crease and blocks

flies away just past second slip. Late away movement snares the edge which evades Kallis as he dives to his left. He was a little late to move, but he would never have reached it. Steyn pulls out a top-draw effort to prevent the boundary
beats him. Excellent line just outside off and the swing away from the bat eludes his tentative prod forward
the inswinger this time and he plays inside the line as the ball strikes his body and runs off towards fine leg
length ball on off stump as Shehzad covers the line and blocks
moves across to off stump and dabs the shortish ball to short-fine leg
shortish ball just outside off and Jamshed rises to his full height and blocks
steered to point off the front foot as the bowler pitches the ball up on off stump
another smart clip off the legs, but he finds mid-on. Morkel was a little too straight with his full length ball that time
back of a length, angled across the batsman who punches it to the covers
146 kph, that made him hop! but he managed well in the end, tucking it away off his hips after getting on top of the shortish ball on off stump
rooted to the crease is Shehzad as he blocks the good length ball on off stump
length ball on the off stump corridor and he is firmly behind it

lovely shot, he's been rather good with that shot this morning and excellent running makes sure they get three. Wants that magic ball that swings from leg stump to square the batsman up, but there is no swing this time as Jamshed clips it square of mid-on
short of a length on off stump as Shehzad steadies himself on the back foot to block
tucked away, but he has found short fine leg. Little ways to either side could have fetched a lot more runs, the ball was short enough and it was coming into the batsman as well
beautiful. Upright seam strikes on the pitch and the ball moves away from the outside edge and into the keeper's hands
length ball on middle, and that is a release for Shehzad as he works it away to deep midwicket

de Kock leaps in the air after he collects that, but neither the bowler, nor the umpire is interested. Corker of a ball, rising from a good length and seaming past the outside edge as Shehzad was drawn into poking at it. The noise was bat hitting pad

uncertainty again, it was just on that length where the batsman doesn't know whether to get forward or back. In the end he wanted to leave it, and the ball thuds onto the bat and runs away to second slip
shuffled a long way across to off stump, so much that his flick shot is of no use as the fullish ball thuds into his pads and settles near his legs
144 kph, goes fuller and with the ball in his arc, Shehzad works it away towards midwicket. Nicely timed stroke
shortish ball on middle and leg as Jamshed punches it past mid-on
short of a length ball with a little room outside off as Shehzad gets up nice and tall to punch it to point
keeps a stump-to-stump line as Jamshed looks to work this through midwicket as well, but only manages to push the ball to the bowler
shortish and on the pads and this time he waits for the ball to reach him and gives a bit of work for deep square leg
punched to cover after he was pushed back in his crease because of that back of a length ball
much fuller that time as Shehzad moves towards his off stump to keep it out
straight to midwicket on the 30 yard circle. Philander errs too straight again and it was there to be whipped away but  only a single results
and this time he is on the pads of the left-hander who picks him away to deep square leg to retain strike. That is the end of the powerplay
143 kph, he was forced to hop again as Morkel bowls a good length ball on off stump. A closed face of the bat on impact though pushes it to midwicket
back of a length as he keeps up a good line on off stump. Jamshed allows it to reach him and tucks it to midwicket
that hurried onto him again, but Jamshed's balance is good enough and he plays quite close to his body, which makes the shortish ball towards square leg

the pressure has got to him. It was just short of a good length but Shehzad was still on his front foot as he looked to mow this down the ground. A leading edge manifests but third man and point are right on the boundary so it falls safely
well played. Short and coming in at his head, but Jamshed swivels on his back foot and hooks the ball, keeping it down as well to picking up a single.
short of a length outside off stump and Shehzad tightens his game, letting it go through to the keeper

that goes straight up! but despite Steyn's magnificent effort at deep fine leg, it bursts through his hands. Jamshed though he was gone for all money, but Shehzad recognised the difficulty in the catch and calls him through for the single. Short ball forced him into the pull shot, but he had absolutely no control over it. The fielder rushed in from the deep and dived forward, but the ball swerved to his right as it was coming down.
shout for leg before, but the ball was back of a length and it was jagging back too much
wanted to slam that short of a length ball through the covers, but he checks his punch
shortish with a little room and he stays back and pushes it to the covers
tries the bouncer, but he can't get it as high as he should. Shehzad was rock solid on the back foot and pummeled the ball to the square leg boundary. Excellent intent
keeps it nice and tight on middle, but Shehzad had shuffled across to the off side and worked it away to fine leg
it was a good length ball and yet de Kock collected that at chest-height. Wide enough outside off for the batsman to leave it alone
145 kph, gauges the line as outside off stump and lets the good length ball go to the keeper

145 kph, complete comedy of errors there, Pakistan were gifting Pakistan a wicket but the hosts said no thanks! Shehzad had dabbed the ball to point and was making his way down the pitch, looking for the non-striker to oblige, but Jamshed was sluggish to start and then suddenly takes off by which time Shehzad was already making his way back to his crease. Point has all the time in the world to throw the ball to the non-striker's end, but the throw was poor and even with both batsmen being at the same end just moments ago, Jamshed is safe
full length ball flicked to midwicket and Jamshed looks for a non-existent single this time. The throw comes in, misses and Pakistan sneak an extra single on the back of a few overthrows
clipped away off his pads as the good length ball is run down to fine leg
back of a length on off stump as he blocks to mid-off
too straight to Jamshed, South Africa have committed that mistake too much in this first hour and he clips to fine leg
moves across to the off side to whip the length ball through to deep square leg
bouncer, but he dug it in too short. The batsman had enough of a sighter to sway away from the line of it and it goes mightily high over his head too
gets forward, keeps bat and pad together and defends well. Good length ball on off stump from the bowler too

more confusion! And Jamshed survives again! He looks back forlornly at Shehzad who explains the ball wasn't placed wide enough of the man at midwicket. Length ball on the pads was clipped away and he went searching for the single immediately, only to hustle back into his crease. Even the dive wouldn't have helped had that been a direct hit
short ball outside leg and he pulls it down through square on the leg side
Shehzad is sent back this time after he pushed the length ball down the ground to mid-off
no turn whatsoever as Jamshed works the length ball from well outside off straight of midwicket
room outside off and it is exploited as the batsman goes back and cuts. There is a man in the deep to mop up though
low full toss whipped straight to midwicket.
tossed up on off stump as he comes forward and defends
another low full toss as Jamshed tries to whip it away through the leg side, but goes to mid-on
good length ball outside off stump as he strides forward to block
138 kph, quick single as he bunts the full length ball to the right of midwicket.

straight to Kallis at wide slip this time and Steyn pulls out half-a-chinsaw celebration. It was a shortish ball angled across the left-hander, amply wide outside off stump to leave it, but he goes for it with the intention of working it down to third man. But he only manages an edge which goes to the slip fielder at chest-high
excellent welcome, but Steyn has just overcooked it. Bangs it right in the middle of the pitch and though the line was right on middle and off, it had too much height

waft outside off and that was so close to the edge! Steyn has a crooked smirk on his face as he turns back to his mark. Lovely away swinger that draws him into a drive on the up. Too early in the innings for that
fullish ball on the off stump corridor and this time Hafeez lets it go through
143 kph, this one rises off a length but Hafeez had pulled out of playing that once he saw it was outside off stump. Better judgemnt
goes wide of the crease to angle the shortish ball at the batsman's body, who pulls his bottom hand away as he defends the ball at his feet
nudged easily just behind square leg as the ball was flighted on leg stump
tossed up outside off stump as he comes forward and uses his wrists to work it back to the bowler
flighted on off stump as he comes forward and defends
forays down the track to reach the pitch as he drives to extra cover to get off the mark
holds it back just a touch but the batsman plays it away with soft hands towards point. Oh and they steal a single. Good running

lovely shot. Calmly pressed his front foot forward to meet the pitch of the ball and knowing there is not too much spin in this pitch, unfurls a square drive that has enough timing to take the ball to the boundary
just back of a length as he dabs it away towards third man off the back foot
slash outside off, it wasn't quite short enough for that, but it did have some room. Some away movement on offer there as well as Hafeez plays and misses

and the romance continues! Edged and goes low to the man at first slip and Amla makes no mistake. That full length ball just manages to nip away to claim the outside edge as Hafeez pushes at the ball. A second later Steyn is leaping high in the air, punching things only he can see. Hmm.. where have I seen that celebration before?
good length ball on and around off stump as he comes forward and blocks
143 kph, drags the length back a bit but remains on off stump as the batsman stays in line with it to block
a little room outside off and Maqsood shows off his timing. Just a gentle push between cover and point as he opened the face on impact and the ball speeds away
slammed over midwicket and deservedly so as he begins with a long hop on middle stump. Shehzad used the crease very well as he went back and struck it dismissively
gets his flight right this time as Shehzad comes forward to drive the full length ball outside off to cover
first sighting of the wrong 'un and it takes the inside edge and goes just over leg stump and dribbles away to fine leg
tossed up on middle and leg as he prods forward to defend
full and outside off as it is steered with an open face through point
another googly, but this one is pushed through and Maqsood has read it and whips it away to square leg
and he was in business there. 144 kph length ball which shapes away after pitching, beating Shehzad's tentative defensive prod outside off
beaten twice in a row! Absolutely no feet from Shehzad and he overbalances after the feeble drive. Late away swing tormenting the batsman here
145 kph, length ball just outside off stump and he is drawn into another poke. More shape away for Steyn and at pace too!
142 kph, this time he goes wide of the crease and pitches it quite full, but the batsman is reluctant to get forward as he manages to keep it out
this time he sees it outside off early and lets the length ball through to de Kock

143 kph, square him up. Shehzad can't do anything about that except say it was too good and concentrate on the next one. He had the line covered for theback of a length ball angled at the body, but not for it straightening after pitching
a little extra bounce for the spinner, but Maqsood was good, meeting it with soft hands and letting it fall at his feet
tossed up on middle as he drives well down the ground
gets nicely forward and drives with the full face of the bat to mid-off
charges down the track but his cover drive finds the fielder
oh, well done Steyn. It was short and dabbed away towards point. Upon the first pitch the ball swerved away to his left, but he stuck his hand out and stopped the runs
tossed up just outside off stump and he goes forward to defend
darts the ball into the batsman, who goes back and pushes it towards midwicket
back of a length on and around off stump as he gets back behind it and blocks
continues bringing the ball into the batsman, who stays on his back foot to punch the length ball to mid-on
not short enough for the pull and he was standing bolt upright while playing the shot too, which heightened the chances of the eventual inside edge. De Kock did well to stop that from running away
135 kph, back of a length and angled at the body as the batsman tucks it off his hips to deep square leg
well played. stays quite balanced at the crease as he gets on top of the shortish ball and guides the ball to deep third man
wrong 'un to start the over and the batsman goes back to pull to deep midwicket
pushed through on leg stump as he keeps it out
just a little room outside off as the ball is a little short. But the guide does not beat third man
dropped Full toss of off stump and he drilled it straight down the ground. Tahir was ducking for cover when he stuck his right hand up and the ball deflects off it. Good fielding in the end?
tossed up on off stump as he strides forward and pushes to mid-off
tossed up on middle as he strikes the ball rather powerfully back to the bowler who does well again
just back of a length on middle and off as he jumps back into his crease to push the ball to mid-on
charges at Kallis and flat bats the length ball to mid-off.

he's gone this time! After threatening for nearly an entire over just recently, he nicks off to the keeper and Kallis has a wicket on his ODI comeback. Steady bowling, on a good length just outside off. Shehzad poked his bat out and watched his edge sit snugly in the keeper's gloves

shuffles across to the off side but this one, on a length, darts into his pads. Misbah jabs at it and gets an inside edge. The ball lobs towards where backward short leg might have been and he is off the mark
full and on the pads and Maqsood cannot get bat on it as he looks to flick to fine leg. De Kock does well behind the stumps again
back of a length on off as Maqsood rises to his full height and punches it back to the bowler
flighted outside off which is met with s strong forward defensive
Masood was eager for the strike there as he charged down the pitch after Misbah pushed that to cover. No run there though
driven just to the left of the bowler, who dives to field the ball.
so full that it was almost a yorker, which Misbah digs out
nicely flighted just outside off as he comes forward to block
another one right up there and Misbah jabs his bat down just in time
another exhibition of his timing as he meets the length ball on off stump with a punchy straight drive off the back foot

another dangerous single by Pakistan and the throw has hit Maqsood in hois jaw. AB was the man at mid-on and had he struck the stumps, Maqsood would have been on his way too. it was a good shot too as he rode the bounce and whipped off his hips
digs it in at Misbah, but gets a little too much height on that.
goes for a fuller length just outside off, which Misbah ignores
fullish length just outside off as he shuffles across to meet it with bat and pad close together

oh, he had to adjust to that one. The full length ball straightened a little and Misbah played it behind square on the off side with an open face. he set off for a single immediately and made his ground, as the throw runs away to the boundary.
angled in at the batsman as he works it away to deep square leg to retain strike
full toss on leg stump is picked away to wide long-on off the front foot
stays put at the crease and shovel-drives the flighted ball to extra cover
that's how you deal with a full toss. Whacks it away straight of the man at midwicket and that scurries off to the boundary
tossed up just outside off and Misbah smothers the spin with a long stride forward
they take AB on and it would have been seriously tight had he struck down the stumps. Soft forward defensive towards short cover and in the end that was well run
ample flight from Tahir and he is slogged it away to wide long-on

Oh dear, South Africa! Mid-off and short cover were staring at each other as the leading edge fell in between them! Kallis cannot understand what was happening as his short ball thudded into the batsman far quicker than he expected. Vernon Philander was at mid-off and he should have gone for it because Smith at short-cover would have had to run backward and take it over the shoulder

punched straight back to the bowler who stuck out his hand. Fell short though and the deflection towards the off side fetches two runs as Kallis is struggling. It seems the problem is his little finger and out comes the magic spray.
lovely shot, but Smith exhibits more conviction at cover this time, diving and pulling the ball back as it was looking to go past him. Charming back foot punch as he makes use of the room on offer
shortish and on off stump as he pulls it strongly in front of square for a single
steers the length ball just outside off to third man for another single
length ball on off stump is pushed to long-off off the back foot
short ball angled in at the batsman who is quick on his back foot and unleashes a controlled pull shot to deep square leg
141 kph, full on middle stump as Misbah walks across to whip it to deep midwicket.
slower ball bouncer, 125 kph, but Maqsood waits for it and dabs it to third man for an easy single
and that is why gully has been placed for Misbah. He strides forward to open the face of the bat and run the good length ball to third man, but is foiled
another slower ball, this time at a fullish length, makes Misbah prod into the off side off the back foot

he's been bounced out! de Kock makes no mistake and Pakistan slide even further in trouble. That rose very awkwardly and Misbah was committed to working the ball towards fine leg, but he only manages to fend the ball into the keeper's hands
shortish and at the batsman's hips as he punches down the ground
gets back behind it and manages to keep the length ball on middle out
fuller length, just outside off and though he isn't getting as much movement as earlier, the batsman can do nothing more than defend

another outside edge and de Kock continues to have a good day. Lovely line and length just outside off prompts Akmal into poking at it and the mistake ends up being fatal for the Pakistan wicketkeeper
Beaten! he goes for an airy-fairy drive straight up and Philander gets this one to swing away from the bat. Delicious bowling

he follows it up with a very poor ball, allowing Afridi to get away with a strong flick to deep fine leg. Morne Morkel does well to get his big frame down to stop the ball before it reaches the boundary
good length ball just outside off is met with a good straight bat
144 kph, more bounce from Morkel and Maqsood had to leap off his feet to get on top of it and uses the slight room to dab to point
exploits the shortish length and some room outside off to steer the ball to third man and collect a single
ducks beneath the bouncer, though this was a little too far outside off stump to have had Afridi in any trouble
slashes at the shortish ball outside off stump and gets the ball square of the third man fielder, but Kallis pulls out the dive and saves two
excellent ball to finish the over. This bouncer was right in line with the batsman and sneaks just over Afridi's ear as he tries to duck
oh, this is high-class swing bowling from Philander. Draws the batsman into poking at the ball with his fullish length and with his seam movement beats the outside edge
goes hard at the shortish ball  outside off and gets a thickish outside edge which runs down to third man
takes on the short ball and the pull shot has enough bat on it to beat the infield and land safely in the region of square leg
another play and miss as this one straightens off a length in that off stump corridor
tries something different as he charges at the bowler to prevent the ball from swinging and slaps it back down the ground
full length ball on middle and leg nudged towards midwicket, but it was in the air for a little while. And that will be drinks
pushes this through on middle and off as Afridi waits on his back foot and whips it away wristily to the man on the square boundary on the leg side
flatter and quicket again as Maqsood gets behind it and blocks

dropped another miss from South Africa in the field and it is their captain. Maqsood charged at him and went for the big launch down the ground, but gets a thick leading edge which was always going away from long-off who had come charging in and he could only get a finger to int
shorter and flatter as Afridi goes back and cuts to deep third man
tossed up on off stump and he drives strongly to mid-on
gets down the track and drills it down the ground for a single
attempted bouncer, but it comes in with too much room allowing Afridi to slash it to deep third man
full length ball on middle as Afridi stays back and presents a straight bat
quick single as he dabs the ball to mid-on. The lack of timing helps Pakistan there as Philander gets a little more bounce than Afridi expected
fullish ball on and around off stump but even though Maqsood was down the track, he can only defend
fullish ball which straightens fetches an outside egde and causes a little excitement, but it lobs towards the vacant cover region.
full and on middle, pushed in the off side and the batsmen run through for a single

Boom! mows it straight down the ground. That's the first maximum of the game. It was the off cutter and he had picked it, getting underneath and slamming it over the long-on boundary. Parnell picks up the catch and it is a good one too, but he is on the other side of the rope
holds the length back and Afridi steers it to third man to rotate the strike

Tahir comes in from long-on and holds on to one and its the big wicket. Maqsood makes the long walk back after playing a very irresponsible slog. Takes on the length ball on off stump, but his wild swing only gets a leading edge and it seemed to pop out of Tahir's hands but smothered it against his chest
full length ball on off stump as Afridi drives into the off side, but can't beat the in-field
short ball on off stump but Afridi wants nothing to do with it
shortish again, this time Afridi gets across to it and lets it run off the open face of his bat to pick up a single to third man
fullish ball on middle and leg, clipped off the back foot to midwicket
gets off the mark in his first ball of ODI cricket, waiting for the length ball to reach him and worked it away to fine leg
he was looking to one-up the bowler by feigning as if he was making room for himself, but Steyn holds steady on a full length on off stump as Afridi has to defend
143 kph, full and just outside off as Afridi opens up his stance, stays leg side of it and goes for a flay through point. Manages a thick outside edge which runs away fine of deep third man

Off comes the leg bail! Everything else remains, even the off bail but that is enough to send Afridi back. Horrible shot as he went right across his stumps to lap the ball over to fine leg. Why would you do that to a bowler of Steyn's pace?
darts it back into the batsman as he keeps it full and just outside off. He watches it go through to the keeper, well judged in the end
steered to deep third man as he takes advantage of a little room given by the bowler outside off stump
ducks under the short ball angled in at him. Anwar has faced two and left two so far
145 kph, back of a length in that perfect corridor outside off. Too good for the batsman who feebly prodded forwards to block

146, another one that reares up and the batsman fends it off with soft hands towards midwicket, but the man swoops in and underarms a direct hit. The South Africans appeal, but he is quite safe which is confirmed by the third umpire.
143 kph, stays leg side as he goes up on his toes to guide the short-pitched ball outside off to point
141 kph, persists with the ploy of testing the middle of the pitch, though this one is a little too far outside off stump to interest the batsman
beats the bowler and it was timed well enough to go through to the straight boundary. Fullish length ball on the stumps met with a solid push
shortish length just outside off and he blocks off the back foot
loses his radar as the bouncer is sprayed down the leg side, with the batsman ducking beneath
141 kph, another good push down the ground but it is straight to Steyn who does well in his followthrough
145 kph, short ball right over middle stump but the batsman had seen it early and took evasive action

146 kph, oh, well played! That was an excellent short ball from Steyn, getting it around throat high, but Anwar leaped up to drop it at his feet with soft hands. Steyn tests his back as he walks back to his mark
goes back to the full length ball and is beaten. The ball sneaks just an inch or so above off stump on its way to the keeper.
nicely clipped away as Morkel goes fuller and strays on the batsman's pads. Excellent running gives them three runs. These two are doing rather well
fullish length ball this time outside off stump as the batsman prods it away with soft hands
this time he was a little less convincing in handling the short ball as he jumped back and gets an inside edge as he looked to cover the angle in at him
short ball outside off stump and he rises to his full height to dab it away to point
steered to third man again as the length ball is met with an open face of the bat
full on off stump brings the batsman forward and makes him defend
147 kph, length ball outside off stump draws the batsman into a little flirt and he is lucky not to get the outside edge. No footwork
this time it comes back into the batsman at 141 kph, and he was still playing inside the line. Can't blame him, Steyn is working up some pace here
ducks beneath the short ball and it was well directed as well, right over middle stump
that rises off a length and de Kock collects it beside his head. He pokes and misses again
this time Steyn goes a little too full and Anwar comes forward and pushes the ball through extra cover. Nicely played, wasn't looking to hit that too hard

short ball rearing at the batsman's head, but he negotiates it well, his soft grip on the bat ensuring the ball is dropped at his feet and that ends the powerplay. Twenty runs and a wicket came off it
is that out?! Miller was the man at midwicket and he fired the throw in, but the batsman has made it. Nice little flick shot after he wet across to the off side to meet the length ball
gives it loads of air as Bhatti comes forward and pushes back to the bowler
Swept to fine leg and Morkel has allowed it to go past him. the ball pitched just in front of him even as he was trying to get his body behind it and the leg spin takes the ball away to his right.
nudged away towards square leg and they pick up a single
went back to punch the ball down the ground for another single
outside edge off an attempted cut shot and it would have gone straight down the non-existant first slip's throat. Little bit of extra bounce there from Tahir
shortish ball angled at the batsman who works it away straight of midwicket
back of a length just outside off stump and he was looking to make some room and pushes towards extra cover and calls his partner through for a quick single
slower ball smeared to cover and Miller plays with the crowd as he raises his arms in the air as if celebrating a catch. Bump ball though

139 kph, excellently-directed bouncer as he has to get off his feet to fend it away towards point. He wanted the single, but Bhatti sends up back and Anwar almost lost his balance as he craws back into the crease
tests him with another shortish delivery, but Anwar is right behind this one and blocks it away
another one that darts into the batsman, but he was moving across to the off side and tucked it away to the fine leg boundary. Clever shot
pushed through at 91 kph and the batsman had to be quite quick with his half-pull-half-flick to deep square leg
that turns the other way and the batsman was not expecting it as he gets beaten and struck on the pads
tossed up on off stump and he keeps it out
flighted outside off and he reaches the pitch to defend
appreciable turn there as Anwar fails to reach the pitch and has to contend with the ball streaking off his outside edge to short third man
pushed through at middle and he stays solidly behind that one
slapped away over midwicket. That has to smart! No. 8 setting himself up in the crease and launching the short ball to sail over cow corner
"push, push, push", comes a call as Bhatti uses the off cut on the ball to work it away behind square on the leg side
moves forward to block the length ball outside off and Bhatti makes the wise choice of denying Anwar's call for a single
short ball, coming into the batsman at 135 kph, and this time there is no room on offer to gain leverage  from. So the pull shot has very little timing goes away towards deep square leg
139 kph, short and wide outside off, he should have been on the back foot but had his weight going forward and misses the slash
employs the open face of the bat to run the shortish ball outside off to third man
bit of turn for him as he stays back to a fullish ball which misses his flick and thuds into his pads
shorter and quicker as Anwar goes back and punches to long-on
tossed up outside off stump as he goes forward to nudge it towards midwicket and they take a well-judged single
just held back slightly as Anwar gets forward and blocks
a little shorter on off stump this time and Anwar plays a short-armed jab to midwicket
flighted outside off and he lets it come to him and chops the ball to point from the crease
134 kph, fullish length coming in on leg stump as the batsman stays leg side of it to block
another quick single, these two have been excellent with those. Played the shortish ball towards extra cover with soft hands and set off straight away
gets hit high on the bat and immediately takes the bottom hand off as the shortish ball gets a little more bounce than usual
overdoes the angle this time and Anwar just picks it away off his legs with a flourish. Brilliant strike and with fine leg inside the circle there as only ever one result
fullish and outside off as Anwar makes room with his front leg and drills it over extra cover to signal the fifty partnership
and he goes one better this time. All along the ground as the cover drive screams to the boundary. Half-volley outside off absolutely dealt with

saw the short fine leg inside the circle and went way across the off side to sweep the full length ball away for a boundary, perhaps. Kicks himself at the non-strikers' end, where he could have been out had the throw hit. Careless work there
holds it back and the batsman gets deep in his crease and punchs down the ground
tossed up and he charges him and drives to long-on
turned away just behind square as fine leg does the work to keep the length ball to a single
full on leg stump forces another sweep shot, but this one is straight to the fielder

oh, that has been pummeled down the ground. JP thought he had Anwar's number when he saw him advancing and pushed the ball wide of off stump. But he reached out and slapped it with a lot of bottom hand
but he gets the same treatment as the short ball is smeared over extra cover. Powerful strike making full use of the room on offer
this time he carts it over the man at deep square leg. He had come in a couple of yards and despite his desperate leap the length ball on middle from Morkel sails over his head

one innovation too many, but that is the end of an enterprising and more to the point, a much needed innings. Ah, but hold your horses, I think we have a review. It was full and straight, the batsman was moving across to the of side to lap it over the short fine leg fielder and gets struck plumb in front. The on-field umpire agrees but the batsman wanted a second opinion, which comes in the affirmative and Bhatti has to go
and he gets whacked on his helmet straight away. Went for an awkward-looking pull shot and wore it on his ear
JP leaps to his right and sticks out a hand but the leading edge sails just a touch beyond him and Ajmal picks up a couple
shortish with some room outside off and Ajmal plays quite a confident little cut shot for no runs. Good call from Anwar. He needs more of the strike
on a length but on the pads as he is whipped away bisecting the men at deep fine and square leg, but Miller does well as he cuts the angle and sends the thrown in a flash
a little more fuller than the last ball, but the batsman who had shuffled across to off stump, manages to work it to long leg
146 kph, searing bouncer from Steyn as Anwar's pull shot is a little too slow to connect

111 kph, slower ball, but he's picked it and drills it down the ground. They take on JP's arm from long-on, but his throw comes in on the half-volley and Steyn can't collect. The batsman was nowhere in the frame. Another run-out missed by SA
149.2 kph, full and just a tad wide of off stump and Anwar goes for a slog, but it is both too full and too fast for him
146 kph, shortish ball hurtling in at middle and let and with no room whatsoever he only swats it towards long-on for a single
142 kph, little room outside off and he gets underneath it, slicing it over point but there is a man in the deep

143 kph, simple catch to mid-off and that shall be Ajmal's last miscue in this innings. It was too quick for him as he goes for a slog. Duminy saw the leading edge, called early, settled beneath it and took a simple catch.
full toss just outside off, slower ball I think, as he jams it into his own pads
141 kph, another full toss, this one at the perfect height to slap back straight down the ground. Duminy almost overran it, but stuck out a hand and manage to keep it in the field of play
wild hoick, something that is expected at this stage, as this is full ball flies to deep third man

and fittingly the innings ends with another possible run-out fumbled by South Africa. It was a full toss again just outside off and the batsman slogs for all he's worth but cannot get bat to it. They rush through for the bye as the keeper misses the stumps. Morkel takes aim at the set in the bowler's end and misses wildly, giving Pakistan another run

inn2.comm: starts off quite well, 141 kph full length ball just outside off stump which is cautiously left alone

oh, that was close! Keeps it quite full as Smith shuffles over to protect his stumps and hoped for a push down the ground, but the ball snares an inside edge and trickles off his pads and could easily have disturbed the stumps
that time his initial movement helped as Junaid pulls his length back and even though the ball was on off stump, he clips it to the fine leg boundary
140 kph, forward defensive from Smith, but all the ball skims off the inside half of the bat and runs away square on the leg side
moves across to the off side quite early and the bowler doesn't like it as he feigns to throw down the stumps after fielding the forward defensive push
keeps it at a good length outside off stump and Smith realises he can't reach this one to tuck away to the leg side and therefore leaves it alone
oh, poor direction there. It was on a decent length, but he sprays it too far outside off

punched between point and cover as the ball smacks right into the middle of the bat and races away. But Ahmed Shehzad makes a brave chase, dives with the ball still ahead of him and pulls it back into the field

the ball is tangled up between Smith's pads as he looked to play across the line. Fullish length going across the left-hander and yet he was searching for the flick through midwicket. Mild shout for lbw

another stifled appeal for leg before and this one does come back just a mite, but it had struck Smith on the top half of the pad as he was looking to work the full length ball on off stump into the leg side again
gets better bat on it as he tucks the fullish length ball angled across him to square leg after moving across to his off stump
another sweet-sounding punch as the length ball on middle is exploited as Smith moves well outside off stump to tuck it away through midwicket
tight bowling after a wayward start as he keeps it on top of off and is rewarded by the batsman limiting his shot to a defensive push
good-looking drive to mid-off for no runs as he strides half-forward to meet the full length ball angled across his body

the stumps are broken but Junaid doesn't realise it as he was going up for the leg before. it was a length ball on leg stump but with Amla going so far across he missed the flick and then it was timber!

what a shot to start! 140 kph short ball outside off stump but with the form he is, de Kock was not interested in ducking beneath as he forehands it through midwicket. He didn't hit it too hard though, just wanted to find the gap
returns to back of a length outside off and de Kock prods at it off the back foot to point
little bit of swing beats the bat as he goes for the cut. The shot was on though with Junaid giving room outside off. The bowler has a little chirp before returning to his mark
length ball on off stump and he goes back pushes to cover
makes room outside leg this time and cuts the length ball off the stumps. Looks like Smith is not going to let him settle
tossed up just outside off and Smith is happy to let this go through to Akmal. Little bit of turn there
comes along with that arm as Smith moves outside his leg stump again. Well bowled by Hafeez as he keeps it full and tight
pushes tentatively forward as he turns the flighted ball towards the square leg region

never-ending appeal from Umar Akmal as Smith jumps outside leg and tries to cut the ball. Hafeez had pushed it through to beat the bat. The ball thuds into the keeper's gloves and trickles onto the stumps at exactly the same time as Smith's back foot rises in order to reclaim his balance. Very tight decision here. There is also concern of Akmal's gloves the reason for the bails being disturbed. But the third umpire sends the red light and Pakistan erupt. I reckon they didn't think that would have been out
flat, but full on off stump as Kallis starts off with solid forward defensive
he is definitely fired up. Takes aim at the stumps again after fielding a firm push from de Kock and indulges in a long follow through and stares at the batsman
waits for it and uses the bowler's pace to steer the back of a length ball past the slips and to deep third man
full and just outside off as Kallis goes for a checked drive. Being new at the crease it strikes the bat on the inside half and goes more towards mid-on when he directed the shot at mid-off
length ball just outside off at 142 kph, as Kallis stays leg side of it and pushes to point
shortish and angled in at the body, Kallis absorbs all the pace as he dabs it into the on side with soft hands
bouncer at 137 kph, but it was a little too short and Kallis had little trouble evading it
pushed through on his pads as de Kock comes forward and defends to mid-on
full length on the off stump and he gets solidly forward to push to mid-off
flatter ball, but right up there as de Kock presents a straight bat
flat and on middle as de Kock keeps it out
charges at him, gets to the pitch and with that out of the way whips the ball straight of midwicket for another very good hit. De Kock is looking rather smooth out there
a little room on offer and de Kock chops it to point off the back foot
pushes the batsman back and he pushes to mid-wicket off the back foot
brilliant from Kallis. 142 kph? no problem, I'll get forward, keep my balance and whip it perfectly through midwicket. His balance there was something to behold!

and this time through the off side. It was just a shade slower at 141 kph this time and it was hit on the up. High front elbow, good stride forward and pure timing takes that extra cover drive all along the ground
back of a length going across the bat as he rises to full height and punches to mid-off
this time the punch goes to cover as he gets right behind the shortish ball hovering just above off stump

138 kph, digs it in to try and unsettle him, but Junaid is the one who is rattled as Kallis pounces on it. Confident pull shot, kept down and sent to the square leg boundary. All three shots skimmed off with a great sound off the bat
didn't have enough room to cut it and it goes along with the arm as well. Could have taken the edge, could have hit off too
oh, did that flick off stump? No, missed it by a whisker. It was pushed through, fuller and even closer at the stumps but de Kock still went for the cut and misses
tossed up outside off and he drives just wide of mid-off. Misbah comes in from cover and has a shy at the stumps, but the batsmen were home
fullish on middle and he pushes it back to the bowler
oh, majestic. It was short and asking to be hit and Kallis obliged with minimum of fuss, lofting it over midwicket for the first six of the innings. Crisssp!
leading edge this time to cut him down to size as Hafeez makes this one straighten after pitching. They sneak a single nonetheless as the ball squirts away towards point
looked to beat the lone slip fielder as he opened the face of the bat to meet the fullish ball outside off, but a diving effort from the fielder foils those plans
checks his shot as he places all his efforts into keeping the bat face straight to adjust himself having gone onto his front foot too early. Full length ball with a bit of nip into the bat
strays on his pads and de Kock happily tucks it away behind square leg to return the strike to Kallis
141 kph, that one bounced a little higher as it thuds into the pitch at a fullish length and hits Kallis' bat on the splice. he did well, removing the bottom hand
140 kph, and Kallis is just a little early into the stroke as he looked to drive on the up. There was enough room for it, but the nip inward defeated him
140 kph, back of a length just a touch outside off stump but Kallis pulls out another trademark strike. Gets right on top of the bounce and punches it just behind point for another excellent boundary
misfield at extra cover allows de Kock off strike after he punches the length ball on off stump
gets across to off stump and nudges the full length ball into the leg side
holds this back and Kallis goes deep in his crease and punches, but finds midwicket
that seemed to be the straighter one as Kallis moved forward and defends
stays on the back foot as he waits for this length ball to pitch on off and tuck it away to square leg
pushed through on off stump as Kallis is in line with off stump works it off his front foot to midwicket. End of that mandatory powerplay.
he's on that in a flash! It wasn't quite short enough and didn't have too much room either, but just as he did in the second T20, he pounds it through midwicket and the ball screams away
the typical quick bowler response as he digs it in short, but the batsman was waiting for it, playing it into the on side with soft hands
144 kph, on the pads again and de Kock works it off his hips to long leg. Standard shot to off line balls
full length ball on off stump and Kallis presses forward and punches the ball to mid-off and it reaches the fielder in a flash

142 kph, his own form has got to him there. Bhatti is channeling some good movement into the batsman and that defeats Kallis' intended punch square on the off side. Brilliant ball, with a touch of extra bounce as well
uppishly guided to third man, intentional strike as he places the back of a length ball outside off wide of the slip fielder
length ball turning into him and he plays it on top of the bounce as he goes back and opens the face to guide to point
nicely flighted there, but de Kock was not tempted. drives it all along the ground to cover point. Well done. This partnership is crucial for SA
pushed through quicker but Kallis is behind it and prods to midwicket off his front foot
quicker and fuller this time as he lets it turn and tucks it just in front of fine leg
oh another lovely ball. I think it was the doosra and de Kock had not picked it up as he pushed forward in a forward defensive
oh he's dragged this short and de Kock gets a little release as he cuts to to deep point

the stumps take a beating as the ball sneaks between bat and pad. Pressure from the other end manifests in a wicket as de Kock goes for a lazy drive. His front foot did not come towards the line of the full length ball on middle stump and with Bhatti's in-cut Pakistan are back in the game
strays too far down leg side with that fullish ball and AB is happy to work it away to deep square leg
ducks beneath the short ball over off stump at 139 kph.
nicely played, angled in at the pads on a full length but Kallis plays straight down the line of it, pushing the ball forcefully wide of mid-on
solidly behind that one as he presents a straight bat to the fullish ball on middle
another punchy shot to cover as Bhatti bowls it back of a length just outside off
the wrong 'un beats Kallis. One a lovely length just outside off and Kallis was expecting it to turn in and is slow on the cut
a little extra bounce as it rears from middle, but he handles it well, pushing the ball into the ground and using soft hands
pushed into the on side as Ajmal holds a lovely length on off stump
a little more flight this time and Kallis gets a bit of a leading edge as the ball runs off to midwicket
much more solid from the batsman as he gets forward, keeps bat and pad together and blocks
tossed up on middle and is calmly pushed down the ground for a single
but this one is a little shortish and outside off and Kallis eases it off the back foot to deep point
immediate call of no as AB gets behind the line of the back of a length ball just outside off and defends
charged the bowler and met it on the full and did not get carried away as he presented a straight bat and the ball has enough to beat the diving fielder who had chased it from mid-on
right behind that lendth ball just outside off as he comes forward to block
shuffles across and nudge the back of a length ball on off stump just wide of midwicket
short ball to end the over, but it is a little too wide outside off to tempt Kallis as he sways away. The umpire calls drinks
length ball on off, punched down the ground and it evades a tumbling Ajmal for a single
little bit of turn there but Kallis was on the front foot and pushes it firmly down the ground to long-on
ample flight this time, he's been teasing all the batsmen with that ball, but AB just drives it along the ground to long-on again
covers his stumps with his back leg as he goes forward to defend the fullish ball

and there's the doosra, to which Kallis comes down the track. Opens the face of the bat at the last minute having read it only off the wicket and hurries back into his crease as the ball only went as far as slip
orthodox off spinner now as he plays with soft hands towards point and picks up a single
shortish and on the pads as Kallis nudges it away off his hips, they were looking for two, but it wasn't there
stays firmly on the back foot and punches the shortish ball outside off to cover
gets solidly behind that and presents a full face of the bat as he blocks the full length ball on middle
back of a length angled into the batsman who pushes to mid-on while in the crease
145 kph, can't time the pull as that ball hurries into him, but even without his timing, AB's running makes sure that shot fetched two runs
146 kph, full and just outside off as AB strides forward and extends his bat skyward
tossed up and gets a little turn as Kallis uses it to exhibit a lovely square drive

AB perishes! Plays back to what he really should have going on the front foot and that is a big blow for South Africa. The "star man" comes out after pushing this one through on off stump and getting the smallest bit of turn, but it was the skid after pitching that did the batsman
tossed up on off stump as he gets forward and blocks
comes down the track and has to adjust as Afridi fires it in at 93 kph, manages to nudge it into the on side
defended into the off side after reaching the pitch of the ball
dangerous again as he goes back to a fullish ball and had he not managed to meet it with the bat, there might have been some more excitement
this time he picks the wrong 'un as kallis goes back and punches the length ball into the covers
ample flight to this one as Kallis goes forward and works it off his legs towards fine leg

loud shout for leg before, but JP was well forward and Ajmal was bowling around the wicket. Pushed through and it went on with the arm, which JP hadn't bet on, as he came on the front foot and tried to defend
tosses it up on off stump as JP defends with a straight bat
stays back again as this one skids in after pitching and he just manages to keep it out
swept away as this is full and on middle stump, didn't look too convincing then either
99 kph, fired in full and on the pads as Kallis works it away through square leg
goes back as this one doesn't turn too much and JP keeps it out
charges the bowler this time and meets the ball at its pitch and unfurls a good-looking cover drive
shortish and Kallis stays back and punches towards the covers
got right forward and nudges it straight down the ground to long-on. JP looking quite busy here
92 kph, full and on the pads again as Kallis whips it to deep midwicket
oh, he had to contend with a little spin into him from around the wicket, but Kallis manages not to overbalance as he tucks it away to midwicket
straight through Anwar Ali at cover as he drives fluently through the covers. No runs though as mid-off backs up well
tossed up on leg and Kallis nudges down the ground to mid-on
doosra and Kallis only picks it off the pitch as he adjusts on his back foot and opens the face of the bat at the moment of impact
steers it towards point after reaching the pitch and JP calls him through for the single
gets nicely forward to smother the turn and blocks
90 kph, length ball on off stump, pushed towards the covers off the front foot
almost a yorker on the stumps as Kallis digs it out to long-off with a straight bat
drops it short and JP goes right back in his crease and cuts the ball to cover point. Too much width there, a rare occurrence from Afridi
another short ball, as Kallis makes a bit of room outside leg and slaps it to deep point
returns to a good, full length on off as he drives to Hafeez at cover
shortish again which allows JP to go back and cut away for a single
tossed up and angled into the pads as JP pushes to long-on
waits for the length ball on the back foot and lets it run off the face of the bat just wide of third man
flighted nicely as JP strides forward and drives to long-off
again camps on the back foot, lets it turn and wristily works it away just wide of third man
meets the nicely tossed up ball on off with a straight bat and long-off is in the game again
length ball on the pads, but Kallis can only clip it to midwicket
flights it just outside off and JP keeps it out
slides down the leg side as it gets some turn, JP was looking to go back and flick it fine, but missed

shortish and excellent footwork makes sure he took full advantage. Went right back in his crease, let the ball go past him before cutting which meant the ball went well behind square to beat cover point
goes back with the turn of that length ball and nudges it into the leg side
tossed up and JP works the angle as he whips it away to midwicket
pushed through flat on middle and Kallis turns it away towards square on the leg side

elegant cover drive. A little too much flight from Afridi as he was looking to tempt the batsman to drive against the turn. Duminy does so, but having strode forward to meet it at its pitch, the turn was made inconsequential
pushed through on middle as Kallis goes back and just manages to keep it out. That went on with the arm when the batsman was looking for spin
another one that beats the batsman outside the off stump as Kallis goes for a drive on the up
nudges into the on side as this one is on a length on middle
chips down the track and whips away straight to midwicket
this time he opens the face and pushes the ball between point and cover to pick up a single
this goes the other way as well but JP was always working the angle and whips it off his hips to deep midwicket
130 kph, loosener with width outside off and Kallis is not about to let that go as he rocks back and pummels it through point
too straight and he tucks it away between square leg and midwicket and Newlands erupts as Kallis celebrates a fifty. This chase rests on his shoulders, I'd venture
too straight to the left-hander this time who clips it neatly towards midwicket off the back foot

he's gone! Kallis is in disbelief as that one sneaks off the bottom of his bat and ricochets onto the stumps. It was a fullish ball on off stump, which skidded onto Kallis quicker than he expected. Anwar and Pakistan celebrate wildly, they know that was the crucial strike
gets solidly behind the line of that as he gets a good foot forward and defends
off the mark with a crisp drive through the covers as Anwar bowls full and wide
pushed through on middle and leg as he gets his bat in front of pad and blocks
oh my God, how has that missed! Pushed through on off stump and it got just that little bit too much turn as it beat the outside edge and the off stump. The pressure is well and truly on!
stays back to a full length ball and has to quickly punch it to midwicket
tossed up and Miller gets forward and defends with an open face and soft hands
that time he meets the full length ball with a solid push to long-off
straight to short leg as he charges the bowler and whips the fullish ball. He doesn't collect it cleanly and JP is back within the refuge of the batting crease
wrong line to start off with, as the batsman tucks for deep square leg to mop up
this time he is too wide outside off, but that ends up a dot ball. JP was stuck in the crease as he tries to swipe at it with just the bat
much better. Back of a length on middle as JP gets behind it and presents a straight bat

that could have sneaked onto the stumps as well, slower short ball and JP's timing went for shot as he looked to pull. It strikes his body and meanders towards the stumps before he stops it with his bat
gets forward to the full length ball on off stump and pushes down the ground to long-on
length ball on leg as Miller clips it straight to midwicket
shortish length allows the batsman to use the depth of the crease and punch to long-off
that darted in after pitching and Miller had to hurry to punch the ball towards the covers
tosses it up and gets a little turn away as JP drives just to the left of cover
tosses it up outside off stump as he defends to cover
leading edge as he looks to whip the fullish ball through the leg side, but it drops well short of the bowler.

loud shout for leg before as Miller goes for the sweep and misses with the bat. The umpire considers it going down leg, but Hafeez disagrees as he goes for a review. It strikes him above the knee-roll and the angle around the wicket and very little spin means the ball would have, as the umpire judged, gone down leg. Hawk Eye shoes it is just clipping the outside half of leg stump and so umpire's call stands
length ball on off stump and JP, on the back foot, is firmly behind that
goes back to shortish ball angled across him and pushes to mid-off
138 kph, short ball taken advantage of as he pulls in front of square and keeps it down as well. Good strike

Anwar has another! Miller throws a look at his partner, possibly asking if he should review, but there was a clean edge. It was the sucker ball, full and outside off stump. He went for it, playing an expansive drive only to get a feather through to the keeper.
allows the length ball outside off to pass harmlessly to the keeper
132, oh what timing! Full length ball on the pads as all Philander does is meet that ball and uses his wrists to imbue such power that it rushes away straight of midwicket
tossed up on off stump as JP drives through the covers and picks up the single
tucks the fullish ball on middle and leg to the man square on the leg side
tossed up on middle as Philander gets back behind it and presents a straight bat
full and on middle as he nudges to straight midwicket off the front foot
flighted on middle again as Philander defends cautiously
tosses it a little wide of off stump and he drives back to the bowler
length ball on off and is crisply driven to mid-off, there was a chance of a run-out but Afridi had misfielded.
stifled appeal, but that struck him too far up the pads. It was darted into the batsman, with a little more pace and Philander's flick was beaten
short with width on offer and Philander chops it to the right of backward point to pick up a single
another quick single, Philander was a little reluctant at first, but they manage to scoot through after JP nudges this length ball on middle just square of the man at midwicket
little bit of shape away as the batsman is stuck in his crease while meeting the fullish ball on off stump. Runs off to over off the outside half of the bat
plays well away from his body as Philander is still trying to find his feet as this shortish ball outside off is pushed to extra cover. Time for another round of drinks
pushed through on off stump as Duminy stays back and blocks
tossed up nicely, but with mid-off three-fourths of the way to the boundary, there was always an easy single on thedrive
97 kph, dragged down and Philander waits for it to turn and cuts it to backward point
took that from just outside off stump as he made his own room to cut that shortish ball to deep point
shortish on off stump again as Duminy goes back to push back to the bowler
thick outside edge squirts between point and cover and Duminy retains strike
driven solidly to mid-off as he bowls full and just outside off
squared him up, that was the off cutter and JP did not know head or tail of that one. A puff of dust off the pitch as the ball pitched and turned away to beat the outside edge
struck firmly to deep cover as Anwar bowls full and just outside off stump
full and just outside off again as he pushes down the ground off his front foot
homes in on off this time as he draws the batsman forward to block
driven straight down the ground, the bowler cannot get to it but mid-off was on hand to stop the single
nudged back to the bowler who bowls it full and on off stump
oh that was well done, lets the ball come to him and even go past him before he late cuts it just wide of short third man
flighted on off and Philander is happy just keeping it out
loads of flight there as Philander strides confidently forward to drive just to the left of Afridi to pick up a single
pushed through with a little width outside of and JP gets right back in his crease and cuts to cover point
chips down the wicket and drives to long-on off another full length ball to retain strike
right up there just outside the off stump as JP strikes it down the ground to mid-off
top shot, JP! Went right forward to meet the fullish ball angled across him, and strikes through the line of the ball which whistles away through the covers
and he goes shortish on the pads and JP is happy to tuck it away towards square leg
gets a little inward movement after pitching as he keeps it on a length just outside off, but Philander is back behind it
140 kph, length ball on the body as he plays a short-armed jab but he finds midwicket
138 kph, there was too much room on that and Philander threw his bat at it. He made no effort to keep it down as the ball sails over backward point off a very thick outside edge
flatish ball on a length just outside off as JP punches to extra cover
this time the shortish ball is punched to long-off off the back foot
on the pads as he nudges just to the right of square leg and sets off. JP was ball watching, but in the end he sets off and makes it
shortish length ball on middle and JP pushes it down the ground for a single
length ball on leg again as Philander tucks it to square leg
this time he gets it fine of the man inside the circle and picks up a single
gets some sharp turn off a length, but Philander manages to ride it and work it away to long leg for a single
it was a little short and the turn gives him enough room to cut, but it goes to point
pushed through on the pads and JP is wise to it as he moves back and across to whip it through square leg

Ajmal, you beauty! That one leaped up off a good length and Philander who was just looking to block it away sees the ball take the splice of the bat and lob all the way to Maqsood at backward point. A determined innings comes to the end as Philander gets a pat from the incoming batsman
goes for a flick down the ground, but that was the straighter one tossed up well outside off stump. Easily beaten
traditional offie this time as Steyn moves back and across to clip to midwicket
tossed up on leg stump as he moves forward and pushes into the leg side
charges down the wicket and he gets struck on the pads. The Pakistanis are up in a loud appeal, but though he was struck in line, he was too far down the pitch
more flight from Hafeez and JP defends solidly

risky single there but all is well as the man at fine leg unleashes a shocker of a throw. JP had charged down the track again and nudged it with soft hands behind square and hared off. Steyn was a little slow to respond
very tentative is Steyn as he goes back to a tossed up ball and blocks using a thick inside edge
pushed through on the pads which is whipped off the back foot straight to square leg
nicely flighted again as JP can only come forward and block. Pakistan slowly taking control of this game
tucked away behind square on the leg side as Ajmal drags this one short and angles it in at JP's pads from around the wicket
struck outside the line as Ajmal pleads earnestly. Ample turn on offer for Ajmal and with him playing a defensive shot that was never going to be out.
beaten outside the off stump as he does not pick the doosra, pushed through on the off stump
this time he manages a thick outside edge that goes to point as Ajmal bowls another doosra
tossed up on middle as Steyn goes forward and whips it to square leg
driven from the back foot through to cover point as he starts off with a back of a length ball just outside off
tries to guide it away to third man, but it was a late decision to combat the ball ducks back into him. In the end he is beaten
well played. That was a smart short ball, coming around chest-high as he dabs it to deep third man, who was late to pick it up and they batsmen take a couple. Junaid is not pleased
stays rooted in his crease as Steyn hangs his bat outside off and finds third man again, hit straight to him this time
worked away off his hips and into midwicket as Junaid bowls it shortish and at the body of JP
142 kph, gets back behind the line of that shortish ball and pushes to mid-off
Afridi goes up in appeal as he strikes Steyn on the pads while on the back foot, but that was darted down the leg side
extra bounce defeats him this time as the ball kicked from a length and turned away from his his cut shot
dabs the length ball to point as he stays rooted to the crease
127 kph, that was seam up from Afridi and Steyn just manages to keep it out. And he even manages a single as the bowler himself sets off after the ball, hit somewhere in the midwicket region
oh, pulls out the revers sweep but the length ball, which was turning into him and cramping that bat swing, made sure the ball went straight to third man who was inside the circle

what blissful timing from JP. I didn't think he had enough on it as he stride forward to meet the ball on its pitch and drives it just wide of mid-off who escorts it all the way to the boundary. Just seemed a little push
full and straight as Steyn stays behind it and blocks
138 kph, oh lovely cricket. He bangs it in short and the ball keeps coming at the batsman's nose, but Steyn does well to sway away from the ball
but this time he has a little waft outside off and the full length ball just misses the off stump on its way to the keeper
Full and allows Steyn to get forward and flay it through the off side infield but there is a man in the deep.
shortish with a little bit of room as JP dabs to deep third man as the required rate pops up to seven.
his feet were made of lead that time as he goes for a needles little push into the off side. Junaid gets the ball to straighten after pitching and beats the bat

oh, that might just be the last straw for South Africa! Duminy goes for the reverse sweep, but the ball was not quite full enough and he gloves it to the keeper who dives forward and picks up an excellent catch. End of another fighting innings from JP, but will this one end up in a losing cause as well?
what a way to start! It was a length ball on off stump and Morkel strides forward with all the confidence in the world and clears long-on. Saeed Ajmal has a glare but the batsman has won that battle
gets a little more bounce than usual as Morkel stands up as tall as he can get and defends
leading edge as he gets one to rip across him from a full length. He was lured into the flick through midwicket because of the angle as the ball lobs towards cover
nudged to the right of the bowler as this one goes straight on after pitching on a good length outside off
loud call of "no" from Steyn as he works the full length ball with the turn to midwicket
138 kph, speared in on leg stump as Morkel stays firmly leg side of it and flicks it away to square leg
mighty slap straight down the ground! It was length ball outside off stump and in the arc for the left-hander and Morkel had no half measures as he creams it down the ground
replies with a bouncer, Morkel was moving away to the leg side to try and upper cut it, but misses completely
oh. elegantly played, making some room for himself again and guiding the shortish ball behind point to pick up a couple
140 kph, almost a yorker which was tailing in but Morkel is saved by a thick inside edge as he looked to drive again
beaten by the slower ball outside off stump. 117 kph, dug in a little short as well, as Morkel's waft while being stuck in the crease amounts to nothing
gets forward and across to the off side as Steyn works the flighted ball towards square leg
falls just short of the man at short midwicket as Ajmal makes this off spinner kick and bounce a little more from a length just outside off
he has had enough of plodding around as he goes down on one knee and executes the perfect slog sweep, miles into the crowd. Another length ball from Pakistan dispatched
doosra this time and Steyn reads it off the pitch as he stays back and opens the face of the bat in defense
tossed up in middle and leg and he gets forward with a good defensive push
and so ends Ajmal's spell with a full length ball on the pads which Steyn is happy to work away to square leg
almost as he keeps it nice and full on leg stump, Morkel with hardly any foot movement, pushes it back to the bowler
uses that ploy which has worked so well for him thus far as he makes some room to cut the shortish ball on middle to point where Ahmed Shehzad dives to his left and keeps it to a single
bouncer outside off stump as Steyn looks to swat it square on the leg side, but comes up with a whole lot of air

that would have made a top-order batsman proud, as good as any shot Kallis had hit today as he charges the bowler and drills him inside out through extra cover for a very, very vital boundary for South Africa
bouncer this time right at the body as Steyn goes towards the leg side and tries to hook it again. This time he gets an inside edge which goes on the bounce to the keeper

144 kph, and the stumps are in disarray again! Misbah's move works as Bhatti keeps it nice and full. A little bit of inward movement beats Steyn's carve through the off side as he made room for himself.
goes for an almighty hit over the extra cover region, but this time he plays and misses to the shortish ball outside off
this time he beats him with one that tails in. Full length ball, reversing inward beats Morkel as he looks to slam it straight down the ground
right up there and tails in again and Morkel gets enough bat on it to squirt away to deep square leg and bounds back to retain strike
139 kph, excellent yorker and Morkel can't do much except keep it out as the ball sneaks off a thick inside edge and onto his pads. Tahir wanted the single but is denied
140 kph, beaten again as Junaid keeps getting loads of swing inward. He was making room to the leg side but the ball tails so much that it beats the inside edge
drilled to deep midwicket as he stays consistent with his full, inswinging deliveries

and Bhatti finishes things off with the perfect yorker on off stump! Morkel made room outside leg to try and drive this through the off side, but he was too late on the shot and South Africa have succumbed in what was supposed to be a straight forward chase.
